oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Douglas and Jean Faircloth MacArthur and son visit Murfreesboro, Address at Middle Tennessee State College, 1951
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: Gen. Douglas MacArthur saluting with other military officers, on the stage with his wife and son and others at the stadium program at Middle Tennessee State College on the occasion of the MacArthur family honorary ceremony in 1951. The city of Murfreesboro welcomed the couple with a parade and celebration in honor of the couples’ 14th wedding anniversary. Jean Faircloth MacArthur was a great-granddaughter of a former Mayor and she had lived for 34 years in a pillared mansion on East Lytle Street. The head of the Murfreesboro household was her grandfather, Capt. Richard Beard, a Confederate veteran. General Douglas MacArthur was an American general and field marshal of the Philippine Army who was Chief of Staff of the United States Army during the 1930s and played a prominent role in the Pacific theater during World War II. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
